Another great choice is "The Whistler" (2016), a captivating film featuring an intriguing plot revolving around a gentle giant who defends the honor of his one true love. The music in this movie adds an extra layer of emotion to the story. Enjoy your viewing!

Another option is "The Lives of Others" (2006), a powerful drama set in 1980s East Germany that follows a secret police agent becoming entwined in the lives he's been assigned to observe, starring Ulrich Mühe and Martina Gedeck. Both films showcase compelling storytelling by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck and offer beautiful film scores. Enjoy your movie time!

I'd highly recommend watching "The Monuments Men." It's a unique World War II film that follows an eclectic group of museum directors, artists, and architects as they embark on a mission to rescue priceless pieces of art from the hands of Nazi thieves. You might recognize some familiar faces like George Clooney and Matt Damon in the star-studded cast.

On the other hand, if you're interested in a historical drama with powerful performances, "Braveheart" is definitely worth watching. This epic tale follows William Wallace, a Scottish warrior who leads the uprising against English rule in the 13th century. It won Mel Gibson an Oscar for Best Picture and Best Director, so it's certainly one not to miss!

The intricate plot revolves around time travel and organized crime, which might align well with your preference for war genre and the unexpected vibe you mentioned.

If you're interested in a more biographical approach to war and politics, "Born on the Fourth of July" is also worth checking out. This film stars Tom Cruise and is based on the true story of Ron Kovic, a Vietnam War veteran who becomes an anti-war activist after feeling betrayed by his country.
